args:
The prince meets up with Chelle and Valyx, and
once again sees a vision of the war from 300
years ago. Everyone then learns of the Blood
Casket—which the Founder King used to seal
the Other's soul into the blood of his royal
descendants—before continuing the pursuit.
Chelle and Valyx! I guess I should have\nexpected you two would show up.

As a general of the empire, it is only
natural for me to respond to a request
from my lord—no matter who that lord
may be.
And as a lady, I try to respond to ALL\ninvitations with the courtesy due them.
And you both came alone?\nNo attendants or guards?
Honestly, have you people even\nlooked AROUND recently?

Clave Loy'elune is the place where the
Founder King and the Other had their
climactic showdown! The secrets of the
royal bloodline sleep within these halls.
It's not a place to casually bring\njust anyone.
Really, I'd prefer you bid your fair\ncolleagues there adieu as well.
But I suppose it matters not. I can't\nimagine you can do anything, even with\nwhat knowledge you might gain here.

Now then! Shall we take advantage
of this opportunity and watch this
grand drama unfold together?
It will be SUCH fun!
Then let the curtain lift! Places, everyone!
Urk... Not even with the sacred blade\ncan I lay this beast low!
You were mistaken from the start to rely\nupon that wretched sword.

It is naught but a symbol of slavery!
To treat that as a ＂gift＂ from the goddess...
You are a fool too stupid even to feel
shame at his own ignorance!
And now...you are without recourse.\nYield to me, Alberius!
W-wrong... I still...have a way...\nI still have a way to seal you!
I had hoped to not resort to this...\nbut you leave me no choice!

Have you lost your wits, you fool?
Or are you simply so craven you would
rather impale yourself upon that blade
than face defeat at my hand?
I am...fully possessed of my faculties,\nfiend. I am...taking the power of this\nsacred sword...into my blood!
This is the only method remaining\nfor me to seal you away...
The secret art of the Blood Casket!
You will sleep forever in a casket of my\nown blood. Your very soul will be sealed\ninside it for all eternity!
If you do that, my soul will be forever\njoined to those of your descendants!

If you do this thing, I will simply find a
way to claim one of them as my new form!
Your so-called ＂plan＂ is naught but a mere
distraction to my dominion!
Ah, but have you forgotten the secret\nof my blood, Morsayati?
I have the dragonblood, a gift and blessing\nof the wyrms themselves. It is enough to\nseal away even your otherworldly power!

It will blend into my blood, and over the
generations your very being will fade to
nothing. This is the hope I entrust to my
descendants!
Base idiocy! One day, Alberius, you will\nrealize the fruitlessness of this endeavor!
It is over. The struggle...ends here...
The soul of the Other...is in...our blood...
...Is that the reason our father changed?
I see now! The fragment we found in the\nfirst Binding Ruin must have awakened\nthe Other in the royal bloodline!
I care not for the reasons. I care only that\nour dear father lost his battle to the Other.
Valyx? What do you make of all this?

The kingdom must not be sundered.
Peace can only be achieved and kept
through the rule of a single power.
If that is the Other, so be it.
How can you say that?! Think about what\nhappens to the people if the Other is\nallowed to take control!
Then you must unite the kingdom under\nyour own rule.
Are you telling me to kill Zethia?!
That decision rests with you alone.\nChoose what you will protect,\nand what you will abandon.
Alberius had to make some pretty tough\nchoices of his own, boss.
I mean, hell! He locked up the Other's\nsoul inside all of his descendants!
But because he had the courage to make\nsuch a choice, he was able to bring about\nan end to his long struggle with the fiend.
No. What we have seen is not the end.
Do you know something else, Zodiark?
I once believed that King Alberius had\ndestroyed the physical body of Morsayati\nand sealed away his soul.
However, the body was not destroyed.\nInstead, it was scattered across Grastaea\nat the end of the battle.
Morsayati's body was a source of evil.\nFiends spawned near it continuously—\nfiends far stronger than the average.

When the king learned of this,
he took the sacred sword he used
to defeat the Other and shattered
it into countless pieces.

Even in pieces, the sacred blade held the
power to seal away the Other. Therefore,
he seeded the pieces in various lands in
an attempt to stay the villain's power.
And those became the Sacred Shards!
By placing the Sacred Shards in any area\nthat held a part of the Other, he was able\nto hold back the power of the Other's flesh.
His search for the scattered pieces of\nthe Other eventually brought him once\nmore to Clave Loy'elune.
Hey! You can't stop talking THERE!
Alberius's end is shrouded in mystery.\nHe vanished suddenly, and none yet live\nwho know his whereabouts thereafter.
What happened to His Majesty?!\nTell us, you fool dragon!
Easy, Cleo—freakin' out ain't a good look\nfor ya. We'll probably find the answer a\nlittle ways down the road here, yeah?
He's right. And if we're lucky,\nwe'll find Zethia waiting for us.
